page.title: 17CONSERVATION AREA
page.content: Our school has a conservation area. That is an area that has been fenced off from the rest of the school field and where we have planted trees and shrubs and wild flowers. A group called Operation South Cannock started us off with our conservation area. They bought some of the trees and plants and helped us dig the drainage ditches. Children from the third and fourth year did all the hard digging and planting. We planted bushes and flowers that would attract birds and insects so that we can study them in our science lessons. We also build a pond which has frogs and fish in it. It also has water plants. A local garden centre gave us a lot of plants for our conservation area.
